metadata.Title: CVE-2022-32166 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
In ovs versions v0.90.0 through v2.5.0 are vulnerable to heap bufferover-read in flow.c. An unsafe comparison of “minimasks” function couldlead access to an unmapped region of memory. This vulnerability is capableof crashing the software, memory modification, and possible remoteexecution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-32166` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openvswitch-common - 2.9.8-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
openvswitch-pki - 2.9.8-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
openvswitch-switch - 2.9.8-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
openvswitch-switch-dpdk - 2.9.8-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
openvswitch-test - 2.9.8-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
openvswitch-testcontroller - 2.9.8-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
openvswitch-vtep - 2.9.8-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
ovn-central - 2.9.8-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
ovn-common - 2.9.8-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
ovn-controller-vtep - 2.9.8-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
ovn-host - 2.9.8-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
python-openvswitch - 2.9.8-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
python3-openvswitch - 2.9.8-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openvswitch package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.9.8-0ubuntu0.18.04.3').
